etymologies: late 19th century (as a trademark): from gran-(representing granular or grain) + -ola (suffix chiefly in US usage). The current term dates from the 1970s

definitions: a kind of breakfast cereal consisting typically of rolled oats, brown sugar or honey, dried fruit, and nuts.
shortDefinitions: kind of breakfast cereal resembling muesli

definitions: denoting those with liberal or environmentalist political views, typified as eating health foods

examples.text: Fran wasn't a grow-your-own granola type

shortDefinitions: denoting people with liberal or Green political views
